description.narrative: 5.1 Improved equitable access to and retention of children (boys and girls) in basic education in Sierra Leone, with a focus on vulnerable groups by the end of December 2019.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.1 Improved equitable access to and retention of children (boys and girls) in basic education in Sierra Leone, with a focus on vulnerable groups by the end of December 2019.

description.narrative: The Ministry of Basic and Senior Secondary Education (MBSSE) helped to ensure access to school for close to 99,000 vulnerable children in hard-to-reach communities, improving equitable access to education in Sierra Leone. Additionally, 127 education stakeholders participated in training to address negative social norms which hinder children's access to education. To promote girls' attendance and retention, 397 school and community stakeholders were trained on Menstrual Hygiene Management (MHM) and 15,000 reusable menstrual hygiene kits distributed in 82 schools to 15,000 girls. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of school community members reached with key messages promoting school enrolment, retention and alternative/positive forms of discipline
Service Delivery - Out of school children in the reporting year who participated in early learning, primary or secondary education through UNICEF supported programmes
Number of out-of-school girls and boys who participated in early learning, primary or secondary education through UNICEF- supported programmes (humanitarian)
